Sentencas: In this work, a novel series of Mn-containing ReBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+ (Re: selected rare earth elements) perovskite-type oxides is studied, with systematic measurements of physicochemical properties being reported.
Titulo: Novel ReBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+ (Re: La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Gd and Y) perovskite oxide: influence of manganese doping on the crystal structure, oxygen nonstoichiometry, thermal expansion, transport properties, and application as a cathode material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Comparison with the very well-studied, parent ReBaCo2O5+ allows determination of the role of the introduced manganese concerning modification of the crystal structure at room temperature and its evolution at high temperatures, variation of the oxygen content, thermal stability of the materials, and total electrical conductivity, as well as thermal and chemical expansion.
Titulo: Novel ReBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+ (Re: La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Gd and Y) perovskite oxide: influence of manganese doping on the crystal structure, oxygen nonstoichiometry, thermal expansion, transport properties, and application as a cathode material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Generally, the presence of Mn cations does not affect the tendency for A-site cation ordering, resulting in an increased unit cell volume of the compounds, as well as causing an increase of the oxygen content.
Titulo: Novel ReBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+ (Re: La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Gd and Y) perovskite oxide: influence of manganese doping on the crystal structure, oxygen nonstoichiometry, thermal expansion, transport properties, and application as a cathode material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Reduced thermal expansion, together with high values of electrical conductivity and suitable thermal stability, makes the compounds containing larger Re3+ cations attractive from the point of view of application as cathode materials in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Novel ReBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+ (Re: La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Gd and Y) perovskite oxide: influence of manganese doping on the crystal structure, oxygen nonstoichiometry, thermal expansion, transport properties, and application as a cathode material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Chemical compatibility studies reveal the sufficient stability of the considered perovskites in relation to Ce0.8Gd0.2O2- solid electrolyte, while unexpected, somewhat increased reactivity towards La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3- and La0.4Ce0.6O2- is also reported.
Titulo: Novel ReBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+ (Re: La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Gd and Y) perovskite oxide: influence of manganese doping on the crystal structure, oxygen nonstoichiometry, thermal expansion, transport properties, and application as a cathode material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the electrochemical tests of the symmetric cells show strong dependence of the polarization resistance of the electrode on the synthesis and sintering temperatures.
Titulo: Novel ReBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+ (Re: La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Gd and Y) perovskite oxide: influence of manganese doping on the crystal structure, oxygen nonstoichiometry, thermal expansion, transport properties, and application as a cathode material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For the selected and optimized NdBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+ layer employed in the electrolyte-supported (LSGM) symmetric cell with a CGO buffer layer, the cathodic polarization resistance is 0.043 cm(2) at 900 degrees C. A wet hydrogen-fuelled button-type cell with the NdBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+-based cathode is also prepared, delivering the maximum power density exceeding 1.3 W cm(-2) at 850 degrees C.
Titulo: Novel ReBaCo1.5Mn0.5O5+ (Re: La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Gd and Y) perovskite oxide: influence of manganese doping on the crystal structure, oxygen nonstoichiometry, thermal expansion, transport properties, and application as a cathode material in solid oxide fuel cells
